TaskDescription.Summary: Scrap news and save it to Excel
TaskDescription.Detail: Access the Chrome browser and clip the news title and save it in an Excel document. The operation runs in the background and does not appear on the screen.

Assist.value: Open a new Excel document in which to save the news title.
Variables to manage the opened Excel document can be specified.
You can display an Excel document on the screen. Click the toggle button to turn off the Invisible property.
Click the Run button to see if a blank Excel document opens.
Open your browser. This time, we will try to connect to Naver.
Select the browser type. Depending on the situation, you may be able to open Edge.
A browser opens and you specify the URL to connect to. Please enter 'www.naver.com'.
Click the Run button to access the browser.
Click the specified object in an open browser. This time we will click on '뉴스'.
Double-click on the highlighted box to assign an object in the open browser. After double-clicking, click '뉴스' to designate an object.
Click the Run button to check the operation.
Click the specified object in an open browser. This time we will click on 'IT/과학'.
After double-clicking in the same way as above, click 'IT/과학' to designate an object.
Click the Run button to check the operation.
This time we will bring you a list of headline news. The imported list is stored as an array.
After double-clicking in the same way as above, mouse over the news title and select when multiple orange squares are displayed.
Specifies the variable in which to store the imported data. Please enter this.chromeResult.
Enter the saved data into an Excel file.
You can specify an Excel document in which to enter values. If you input as ACTIVE_EXCEL, the value is entered in the currently active Excel document.
Enter the variable this.chromeResult set in the previous step.
Save the created Excel file.
You can specify the file path to save the Excel document. Enter 'C:\\News_Scrapping_Test.xlsx' .
You can specify the Excel document to be saved. If you input as ACTIVE_EXCEL, the currently active Excel document is saved.
You can close the previously opened Excel document.
You can specify the Excel document to close. If you enter ACTIVE_EXCEL, the currently active Excel document is closed.
Close the Chrome browser opened earlier.
You can specify which chrome pages to close. Typing as LATEST_BROWSER will close the last opened page or browser.
